title: Samsung’s Galaxy A54 is an Affordable Way to Get One of the Best Smartphone Displays
description:
The Pixel 7a is around the corner, but if you don’t care for Google’s series of smartphones, there’s always a Samsung alternative. title: The Last of Us' Clicker Recording Sessions Contain No Zombies, Only Audio Terrors
description:
While HBO’s The Last of Us might have spent most of its time reinforcing the fact that in any given apocalypse, human beings are the worst of all monsters—the show’s clickers were also downright terrifying too. Prepare yourself for the horrifying flashbacks that will come with this video of performers recording the …

title: Star Trek: Picard's Showrunner Says Its Latest Surprise Return Always Had to Be the Plan
description:

title: Man Who Ran a Website that Illegally Streamed Major League Sports Gets 3 Years Behind Bars
description:
A Minnesota man was sentenced to three years in prison on Thursday for illegally streaming major league sports content to outside third parties. Joshua Streit, also known as Joshua Brody, was arrested in 2021 after an investigation found he had hacked into a Major League Baseball system and attempted to extort…

title: Belkin's Wemo Products Will Take a 'Big Step Back' From Matter
description:
One of the most popular brands for smart home tech, Belkin’s Wemo, is officially pausing development of Matter devices. What was supposed to be a revolution in interconnectivity and ease of access has now lost one of its biggest contributors.

title: OneWeb Has Given Up on Trying to Get Its Hijacked Satellites Back From Russia
description:
British satellite company OneWeb is counting its losses, and not its satellites. Following a fallout with the Russian space agency that led to 36 of its satellites being held captive in Kazakhstan, a company official said that they have “moved on.”

title: Experimental Pill Shows Promise Against Leukemia in Early Trial
description:
In a study out this week, scientists describe a novel experimental pill that may be able to help patients with a difficult-to-treat form of leukemia. Nearly half of patients in the Phase I trial responded to the treatment, called revumenib, while about a third experienced a complete remission of their cancer. More…

title: Ember's $400 Baby Bottle Heats Milk (Or Formula) to 98.6 Degrees in Five Minutes
description:
Best known for its self-heating cups and mugs that come with spit-take inducing price tags, Ember is expanding its precise temperature control technology to wee ones with its new Ember Baby Bottle System, which promises to save parents from having to guess if milk and formula is at the perfect temperature for an…

title: Parents Group Demands Meeting With Meta and TikTok Over Child Suicide
description:

title: One of the Oldest Warriors in Warhammer 40K Is Getting a Glorious, Gold-Toed Update
description:
When zillions of people die every other minute in the grimdark future of Warhammer 40,000, a long life is something to be feared—and no one embodies that more in Games Workshop’s esoteric lore than Luis Dante, the leader of the Blood Angels Space Marines. title: YouTube TV’s Price Is Increasing to $73 a Month, and It Makes Me Want to Cancel My Subscription
description:
YouTube TV has announced that it’s increasing the monthly price of its basic tier of over-the-air streaming TV. The company made this known in an email to current customers. I received an email this morning telling me my $65/month subscription is going up to $73/month. That doesn’t include the $16/month I pay for HBO…

title: Leading Denier Think Tank Uses AI Image of Dead Whale and Wind Turbines
description:
Readers of the daily email newsletter of one of the country’s leading right-wing, fossil fuel-funded think tanks were treated to a bizarre sight this week: an AI-generated image of a dead whale washed ashore on a beach in front of wind turbines, above a fearmongering story about offshore wind. title: Amazon Go Store Accused of Violating NYC Facial Recognition Laws
description:
Amazon is facing a class-action lawsuit that was filed on Thursday, claiming the company did not inform Amazon Go customers that they were being recorded at its New York City location. title: These 13 Images Depict the Most Realistic CGI Dinosaurs Ever
description:

title: NASA's Mars Orbiter Appeared to Be Running Out of Fuel—Until It Wasn't
description:
For nearly two years, NASA engineers had been worried that the fuel supply of the Mars Odyssey orbiter was running low, bringing a tragic end to the precious spacecraft. But as it turns out, they had miscalculated what’s left in the orbiter’s gas tank and that it’s good to go for another two years, according to NASA.

title: Somebody Sold a 'Pixel 7a Prototype' On eBay For Five Times Its Purported Retail Price
description:
An eBay user spent more than $2,500 for what might be Google’s upcoming mid-range phone, a device that by the seller’s admission doesn’t even work. Whatever you think of the sale, it at least means we’re getting a few more pictures of the alleged Pixel 7a that could be hitting store shelves in just three month’s time.

title: Twitch CEO Emmett Shear Resigns After 16 Years
description:
Twitch, the livestreaming platform that’s brought us infinity steamed hams and an avenue for gaming creators to more easily monetize their video work, is going through a transition. The Amazon-owned company’s CEO and co-founder, Emmett Shear, is resigning after 16 years spent leading Twitch into what it is today.

title: Legend of the White Dragon, Jason David Frank's Final Film, Will Release in Theaters
description:

title: The Latest HIV Cure Is the First of Its Kind
description:
Doctors say they’ve likely cured yet another person of HIV using a specialized form of stem cell transplant. The patient has remained HIV-free for six years and is the first known woman to have successfully undergone the procedure. The doctors used a novel technique that transplanted stem cells from a relative and a…

description:

description:

You like your little paid scraps of freedom, personal leave, and sick time that allow you to indulge in frivolous human needs like going to the doctor, seeing faraway family, or resting when ill? title: Damn, Where Has This Star Trek: Picard Been?
description:
Star Trek: Picard is a show that, for its first two seasons, vacillated wildly between whether or not it wanted to be a self-serious look at how time had changed and wounded Jean-Luc Picard, or a daring, often unhinged heroic adventure for its titular hero. Its third season has been as strong as it is nostalgic, but…

title: Texas Education Officials Want to Rewrite Climate Science in State Textbooks
description:
Officials in Texas want to make sure the state’s science textbooks don’t paint oil and gas in a bad light. The Texas State Board of Education shifted its guidance to schools last month, asking that they focus on the supposedly “positive” aspects of fossil fuels in educational material, E&E News reported.

title: If You Can Decipher These 2,000-Year-Old Scrolls, You Could Win $250K
description:
In 79 A.D., Mount Vesuvius lay waste to a library in Herculaneum that was owned by the father-in-law of Julius Caesar. Now, former GitHub CEO Nat Friedman and some scientists are giving $250,000 away in prizes to the person or team who successfully uses modern technology to decipher scrolls recovered from the site of…

title: The 7 Weirdest Things About Venus, Hell Planet
description:
It’s been 30 years since a NASA spacecraft went to Venus, a yellowish planet 67 million miles from the Sun and 141 million miles from us. Venus is often thought of as a sibling planet to Earth, both being rocky worlds close enough to the Sun to bask in its heat. And yet, at some point in their histories, the two…

title: Everything We Learned From the NASA-Axiom Moon Suit Unveiling
description:
Axiom Space revealed its new Moon suit yesterday during an event held at NASA’s Space Center Houston. It’s the first Moon-specific suit since the Apollo era and a key component of NASA’s Artemis program, which seeks to return humans to the Moon later this decade. Here’s what we learned about the new suit, dubbed AxEMU.

title: Ben Affleck Says He's Done With DC Films, No Matter Who's in Charge

title: Microsoft Stuffs AI Into Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and More
description:
Microsoft is now putting its AI into all of its 365 apps, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Teams, and more. What’s more, Microsoft said it will be accessing your data, including anything you might have in your OneDrive, email, and beyond, to personalize all the content this so-called “Copilot” generates.

title: This 20 Pound Portable Microwave Can Heat 11 Meals In Between Charges
description:
Sometimes, the only thing that can get you through a long day of work is having a hot meal halfway through it. That’s not always an option if you’re stuck on a construction site, or even on the road, unless you’ve brought along Makita’s latest power tool: a cordless microwave that zaps instead of cuts.

description:
After a slight delay due to weather, Rocket Lab is ready to fire off the engines of its Electron rocket and send an Earth-imaging satellite to low Earth orbit.

description:

title: Virgin Orbit Suspends Operations and Furloughs Nearly All Staff
description:
Virgin Orbit is pausing all impending operations after announcing it is furloughing the majority of its staff in a companywide effort to cut costs and secure investor funding. The company informed its staff of the furloughs at a meeting on Wednesday, telling employees they would receive further information next week,…

title: Sorry Siri: Meet Petey, the New ChatGPT App for Apple Watch
description:
There’s a new ChatGPT app for the Apple Watch called Petey, and if Siri had feelings, she’d definitely be worried. You can speak to Petey using voice-to-text and hear it read back responses in a cute little robot voice, then share its AI answers over text or email.

title: FTX Entities Paid Bankman-Fried and Other Top Execs More Than $3 Billion Before Collapse
description:
As down-and-out crypto exchange FTX struggles through the miasma of Chapter 11 bankruptcy, seeking to recoup funds needed to make customers and investors whole, the company now says there was around $3.2 billion dolled out to former CEO Sam Bankman-Fried and five other members of his inner circle before the collapse.

description:
Two days ago, the U.S. Armed Forces claimed that a Russian Su-27 aircraft crashed into a U.S. Air Force MQ-9 drone over the Black Sea, causing the MQ-9 to fall into the water below. Today, U.S. European Command has released declassified footage of the incident.

description:

description:
The fight between the U.S. and China over TikTok reached a new infection point on Wednesday when the Biden administration demanded that ByteDance, the social media app’s Chinese owners, sell off its stakes in the app or get ready for a possible ban.

title: This Is Why You Feel Existential Dread When You Open Instagram and TikTok
description:

description:
